page.title: 12HEADCORN'S YOUTH ACTIVITIES
page.content: The{Scout and Guide}movements are both very active in Headcorn. The Scouts and{Cub Scouts}have their own meeting hut whilst the{Guides}and the{Brownies use the Primary School hall. There are about 30 Cub Scouts and as many as 50 Scouts. These latter meet on Fridays from 7.15 till 9.30 and are organised into 7 patrols. Activities include tracking,making camp fires,camping and canoeing. They raise funds by a weekly subscription and by collecting waste paper. They also hire out the troop's own coach. The Guides are equally busy and this year because it is the 75th. anniversary of the founding of the Guides they went to a special rally at Crystal Palace in London and to an area camp at Leeds Castle. The{Boy's {Brigade}exists in the village but it is small scale. There is also a very popular youth club for teenagers.
